channel.title: Projections relatives à la COVID-19 à Ottawa on Ottawa COVID19
channel.description: Recent content in Projections relatives à la COVID-19 à Ottawa on Ottawa COVID19

item.title: Model parameters
item.description: Projections are based on the reported daily hospital census for Ottawa. Daily hospital use reported by Ottawa Public Health. Model parameters other than Ottawa hospital use are aligned with other models. Model parameters are described below. Parameter estimates are from COVID-19-MC and Tuite, Fisman, et al. models where possible, with updates based on Verity et al. (Lancet, March 20, 2020)* and Ferguson et al.

Model use There are two main uses of the projections: Short-term projections (2 to 4 weeks) to inform the immediate need for hospital and critical care services for COVID-19 patients. Long-term projections (6 weeks onward) to assess the effect of relaxing physical distancing. Model accuracy Creating accurate, long-range projections to predict the spread COVID-19 is difficult. It’s akin to forecasting when a hurricane will make landfall when it is still thousands of kilometers out at sea.

item.title: Changelog
item.description: Updates involving only data updates will no longer be documented. V2.1.4 2020-06-15 Increased transmission projections reduced from 20% to 10%. V2.1.3 2020-06-01 Changes to colours of plots and removal of redundant headings. V2.1.2 2020-05-29 Updated figures in more. V2.1.1 2020-05-25 Data is now specific to Ottawa residents currently hospitalized. Added definitions on homepage. Change in terminology from distancing to transmission in projection plots.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Personne-ressource pour les médias : Michaela Schreiter, agente des relations avec les médias, L’Hôpital d’Ottawa. Courriel: mschreiter@toh.ca Téléphone : 613-222-7674 Personnes-ressources scientifiques : Doug Manuel dmanuel@ohri.ca, Warsame Yusuf waryusuf@ohri.ca, Alan Forster Remerciements pour le site Web et le contenu : Warsame Yusuf, Rostyslav Vyuha, Yulric Sequeira, Andrew Fitches et les autres membres de l’équipe de Big Life Lab. Avec le soutien des épidémiologistes de Santé publique Ottawa : Amira Ali, Jacqueline Willmore, Dara Spatz

item.title: Roadmap
item.description: The main purpose of this site is to visualize Ottawa-based projections for models performed by other teams. Review and update model parameters based on recent published studies. Priories for review: ventilated patients deaths
